org.easybatch.jpa

Class JpaTransactionStepListener

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.easybatch.jpa.JpaTransactionStepListener
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    RecordProcessorEventListener

    public class JpaTransactionStepListener
extends java.lang.Object
implements RecordProcessorEventListener
    Listener that commits a JPA transaction after inserting a predefined number of records (commit-interval).
    Author:
    Mahmoud Ben Hassine (mahmoud@benhassine.fr)

    • Constructor Detail

      • JpaTransactionStepListener

        public JpaTransactionStepListener(javax.persistence.EntityManager entityManager)
        Create a JPA transaction listener.

        A JPA transaction will be committed after each record.

        Parameters:
        entityManager - the JPA entity manager

      • JpaTransactionStepListener

        public JpaTransactionStepListener(javax.persistence.EntityManager entityManager,
                          int commitInterval)
        Create a JPA transaction listener with a commit-interval value.
        Parameters:
        entityManager - the JPA entity manager
        commitInterval - the commit interval

      • beforeRecordProcessing

        public java.lang.Object beforeRecordProcessing(java.lang.Object record)
        Description copied from interface: RecordProcessorEventListener
        Called before the record gets processed. If you create a new record, you must keep the original header of the modified record.
        Specified by:
        beforeRecordProcessing in interface RecordProcessorEventListener
        Parameters:
        record - The record that will be processed.
